author: Sheree
title: Collab Directory and Events
description: Problem is in generating awareness of Catalyst and how it can be used as well as finding people who will accept payment via ADA.

assessments.note: From one point of view, I would say yes, it can have a positive impact, but given their goal - 20 proposals after 3 months, I would say that is VERY INEFFECTIVE. so 1-3 stars.

As some other Ideascale members have commented, the proposal is approaching two separate issues, so for clarity and better integration into the challenge I would suggest that it should be split into two separate proposals. The first one should be about generating awareness about Project Catalyst and the second about "finding people who will accept payment via ADA" and see how that second one might fit into this category.
Not clear that 100,000 for 20 submissions is a great contribution.

This is a really valuable project for the community since it reaches a variety of people that might be very hard to reach. I really enjoyed how everything is designed and the idea of giving solutions to small business (SB) using the Cardano ecosystem. That is a totally different point of view and to implement which could open the minds of this public and they gonna 'spread the word' as well.

This proposal addresses Cardano Fund 5: Proposer Outreach Challenge. The project proposal is solid and can encourage entrepreneurs from outside the Cardano ecosystem to submit proposals to Catalyst. The problem and solution in the proposal are well described and explained. This proposal, if implemented correctly, will bring a lot of new proposers to the Cardano Ecosystems.

The proposal potentially addresses the challenge of proposer outreach although it is difficult to assess how efficient it might be given the target audience is small business operators. Yes they potentially could benefit from blockchain technology but is the community likely to see a host of proposals in upcoming fund submissions?
I am skeptical. For a running project, they have only 4 followers. Also, they are only two people, trying to achieve (as they admit in the comment) the same thing as catalyst.

The plan is too general, it covers most points, but none explicitly. A lot of good ideas have started to emerge, but none was described in detail. There are several mentions of raising awareness, but no detailed description of how that would be achieved.

Since you are already running with the project and the platform is working, I feel that it would be great to detail even more the spending, once you are requiring all the fund value – which allow other projects to coexist.
One thing that made me curious in the "what would be different" section is: are the project aiming on training a team which is capable of bringing solutions for SB? Because I think that this might be not scalable and the costs would be huge. This idea could culminate in the community participation, where you can open to the community to find a solution and maybe a partnership with the business, or even a reward – which I think would be less spending than have your own team and would show how the community works together.

Other than that, if you win this fund and start this project together with the Catalyst it is of your intention to make it annual, the "Culture of Innovation" – however it has costs, as you've shown. Therefore, how are you intending to continue with the Catalyst every year?
It is likely for this proposal to be implemented because it includes a straightforward plan that will be implemented successfully after funding.

The experience of the team is difficult to qualify for such a large task that is being proposed. I have no concern about the business acumen that relates to mentoring SMS/s but am unsure if this will translate directly to proposals from those SME owners. The plan seems a little unwieldy at this stage and would likely benefit from being broken down into smaller parts. This I feel would be well received by the community and allow for a greater degree of trust building that such a large project necessitates. It would certainly assist with the budget request which seems excessive given the niche market of the proposal.

to have atleat 20 new proposals after 3 months - 

but we do not know how to find it? Also, the impact of budget/new proposals is very low.

The budget is not detailed, they admit to not knowing exact costs "These are best estimates and we have not secured direct costing". The metrics are not clearly described, the project has no clear direction, it will be a platform for small businesses, a hackathon, a pitch fest, a showcase of previous Project Catalyst funded projects etc.
The success metric or 20 new proposals for the entire amount available in this fund seems like it would fail to make much meaningful impact in meeting the challenge.

I missed some KPI and metrics to validate the correlation between newcomers and this project. How are the team willing to measure this?
Furthermore, a more explained budget would be great to add value in this proposal and a form to verify the spending.

The attached document's Roadmap is clear and provides an in-depth, step-by-step action plan, making this project easier to audit. 
The only question is what is an estimated amount of people or entrepreneur your plan to reach with this project?

Generally the information provided is sound and allows some grasp of the big picture. There is room for greater detail which is applicable for a project this size. I feel the budget requested is asking a lot of community. Should the proposal be staged with smaller achievable milestones it would likely be well received. Provision of examples of the educational/training resources for example would assist the community to make a better informed decision when voting.

solution: sixty:forty is a directory for alternative payment and we are running a 3 month long Culture of Innovation campaign in Quarter 3.
experience: We are a team of Accountants, Brand & Marketing, PR, Graphic Design and Developers. We have been in small business for over 20 years each.
